title_full: DALPER08-BP01 Identify analytics solutions that best suit your technical challenges
title: Identify analytics solutions that best suit your technical challenges
description: The definition of best-performing will mean different things to different stakeholders. Gather all stakeholders' input in the decision process, define performance and cost goals by balancing business and application requirements, then evaluate the overall efficiency of compute solutions against those goals.

title_full: DALPER08-BP02 Provision compute resources to the location of the data storage
title: Provision compute resources to the location of the data storage
description: Minimize data transfer latency and costs by provisioning compute resources in the same region and availability zone as your data storage. Use services like Amazon EMR, Amazon Redshift, or Amazon Athena that can access data directly from Amazon S3 without data movement.

title_full: DALPER08-BP03 Define and measure the computing performance metrics
title: Define and measure the computing performance metrics
description: Establish key performance indicators for your analytics workloads including query latency, job completion times, and throughput. Use CloudWatch metrics and custom instrumentation to measure and track performance against defined goals.

title_full: DALPER08-BP04 Continually identify under-performing components and fine-tune
title: Continually identify under-performing components and fine-tune
description: Regularly analyze performance metrics to identify bottlenecks and under-performing components. Use performance tuning techniques for Amazon Redshift, query optimization for Athena, and Spark tuning for EMR to continuously improve performance.

title_full: DALPER09-BP01 Identify critical performance criteria for your storage workload
title: Identify critical performance criteria for your storage workload
description: An analytics workload's optimal storage solution is influenced by factors such as compute engine, access patterns, required throughput, access frequency, CRUD operation requirements, data durability requirements, and archival requirements. Identify and prioritize these criteria for your specific workload.

title_full: DALPER09-BP02 Identify and evaluate the available storage options for your compute solution
title: Identify and evaluate the available storage options for your compute solution
description: Evaluate storage options compatible with your compute solutions including Amazon S3, Amazon EBS, instance storage, and Amazon FSx. Consider the integration capabilities with services like Amazon EMR, Amazon Redshift, and Amazon Athena when selecting storage.

title_full: DALPER09-BP03 Choose optimal storage based on access patterns and performance requirements
title: Choose optimal storage based on access patterns and performance requirements
description: Select storage solutions that match your access patterns (random vs sequential), data growth expectations, and performance requirements. Use Amazon S3 for cost-effective object storage, EBS for high-performance block storage, and appropriate S3 storage classes for different access frequencies.

title_full: DALPER10-BP01 Select format based on data write frequency and update patterns
title: Select format based on data write frequency and update patterns
description: Selecting the best-performing file format and data partitioning can have a large impact on overall analytics workload efficiency. Choose formats like Parquet or ORC for append-only workloads, and consider Apache Hudi or Delta Lake for workloads requiring in-place updates.

title_full: DALPER10-BP02 Choose data formatting based on your data access pattern
title: Choose data formatting based on your data access pattern
description: Select columnar formats like Parquet for analytics queries that scan specific columns, or row-based formats for workloads that access complete records. Consider the read vs write ratio and typical query patterns when selecting formats.

title_full: DALPER10-BP03 Utilize compression techniques to decrease storage and enhance I/O efficiency
title: Utilize compression techniques to decrease storage and enhance I/O efficiency
description: Apply appropriate compression algorithms such as Snappy, GZIP, or ZSTD to reduce storage costs and improve I/O performance. Balance compression ratio against CPU overhead based on your workload's characteristics.

title_full: DALPER10-BP04 Partition your data to enable efficient data pruning
title: Partition your data to enable efficient data pruning
description: Implement data partitioning strategies based on common query predicates such as date, region, or category. Effective partitioning enables query engines to prune unnecessary data, reducing the amount of data scanned and improving query performance.
